result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J. McCall Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

per Defendant in court. lmw

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb,ADA:  Sharon Correll   DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea   DF:  Michael J. McCall appeared.  Court called at 3:03 p.m.  Set for a PTC.  There is an agreement.  State moves to amend to disorderly conduct misdemeanor.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights.  DE would like to speak with his attorney out of the courtroom.  Recess at 3:07 p.m.  Court recalled at 3:13 p.m.  Crt questions the DE.   Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty.  DE pleads No Contest to the amended Ct. 1 Disorderly Conduct Misdemeanor.   Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 1 Disorderly Conduct Misdemeanor.  Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

- Court costs of $243.00 
- DE to meet with payment clerk for a payment plan
- 20 days to appeal
NOH from PO as Return to Sender, Not Deliverable as Addressed, Unable to Forward. gme

Court called at 3:31 p.m.  Victim has submitted a letter on behalf of the DE.  Attorney Andrea argues jurisdiction and where the incident happened.  Attorney Andrea may file Motions.  Continue PTC.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned at 3:34 p.m. lw  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference on August 17, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

-Prior to leaving the courthouse, report to St Croix County Jail for mugshots and fingerprints.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Heather T.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.

CO: EJL, RPR: Val Deiss, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley & Ryan Moertel,  DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea,  DF:  Michael J. McCall appeared. Atty Caton submits a written statement from the Victim. Court confirms address.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 03:15 pm.
